sentences.sContent: Marye, my doctors, and a minute bit of common sense will keep me off the rock climbing walls.
sentences.sContent_eng: Marye, my doctors, and a minute bit of common sense will keep me off the rock climbing walls.
sentences.sCn: 我的医生，以及一丁点儿的常识将使我远离攀爬岩石或高墙。

sentences.sContent: As with sky diving or rock climbing, speaking before an audience becomes easier the more often you do it.
sentences.sContent_eng: As with sky diving or rock climbing, speaking before an audience becomes easier the more often you do it.
sentences.sCn: 如果反复练习，与跳伞或攀岩运动相比，在听众面前演说就会变得越来越容易。

sentences.sContent: Up until my class began, I was under the impression that I would do a lot of climbing as part of my rock climbing class. I did make it up a small wall during the class, so there was some climbing.
sentences.sContent_eng: Up until my class began, I was under the impression that I would do a lot of climbing as part of my rock climbing class. I did make it up a small wall during the class, so there was some climbing.
sentences.sCn: 直到我的课开始我才知道，因为在我的印象里，我将会作很多攀岩练习作为登山攀岩课程的一部分--------我在教室里的一座小墙上做一些上下攀爬练习，但是，课程主要是专注于攀岩设备和安全措施，练习绳结。

trans.tranOther: the sport of climbing up very steep rock surfaces such as the sides of mountains
